intro: Pentameris veneta, commonly known as the Venetian pentameris, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
